website_summaries.verdict: Fun features and chic styling make the Nikon Coolpix S60 a tasty choice for casual point-and-shoot use. However, if you need speed or snapshot perfection, this isn't your camera.
cons: all but the power and shutter are touch-screen controlled

customer_reviews.title: A Good Product!
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand the bad reviews that this camera has gotten. To me it is like my iPhone, intuative and easy to use! Takes great pictures too! My only disapointment is that a premium priced Point & Shoot camera like the S60should not have been shipped without a SDHD memory card (even if only limited capacity!). Make sure you buy this camera AND a SDHD card at the same time, without the card you will have only 9 or 10 photos before you must delete or download to your computer.
customer_reviews.author: Mooney Pilot

customer_reviews.title: outstanding
customer_reviews.text: This is the best camera that I have ever had. Everywhere I pull it out to use it people cant believe that I could write on the screen and then when I print it off the stuff I wrote on the screen was printed on the picture. Everyone ask me where I got it , and I told them all to get on line and go to Amazon.com--- I love this camera. My daughter is 11 and this is what she is wanting for Christmas now.
customer_reviews.author: atv fan

customer_reviews.title: It's a NIKON.
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. It looks weak at first but after a couple of drops I can tell you that it can take quite a few hits without any damage. The photos are stunning. Everyone in my family wants one. Buy an extra battery just in case. I agree that zoom in and out with the touch screen is not the best option, but it is worth the trouble for this quality.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Enciso

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to take to Italy with me and it did a fantastic job . My pictures were clear and it 's ease of operation made me appreciate it even more. It was light and easy to travel with and the touch screen is very responsive yet not overly sensitive that it would do commands without me wanting them. I would recommend this to anyone who wants a great picture and is not familiar with having a digital before.
customer_reviews.author: KatieQ

customer_reviews.title: Nikon Coolpix S60
customer_reviews.text: Bought the camera as a Xmas gift for my wife. She loves it especially the built in picture editor. Very easy to use and takes great pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Abney

customer_reviews.title: Nikon Coolpix S60
customer_reviews.text: Excellent design, color and portability. Image Quality,easy of use and picture quality: Excellent! No complaint about this product. It is a 5*
customer_reviews.author: Diana Yong

customer_reviews.title: Negative,  NOT!
customer_reviews.text: Super is how I would describe this camera. Display is great. Feels good to handle. Relatively easy to navigate menus displayed on the view window, a convenient feature. I almost did not buy this after reading the negative reviews, but it seems to me these are simply wrong. I have yet to print from the card, but I assume and 10 mp it will do fine. If you are on the fence on this one, go ahead, take the plunge!
customer_reviews.author: William H. Boothe

customer_reviews.title: Bad picture quality
customer_reviews.text: We have been very disappointed with this camera. We have always had a Cannon but decided to go with Nikon's new product. With 10 megapixels you'd expect a picture to be crystal clear, but our old Cannon was 7 MP and took better photos on a lower setting than this does on it's highest. Also, the touch-screen, which we thought was a great selling point, is very frustrating to use. I would especially not recommend it for older people, just to zoom in and out with the touch screen vs. actual buttons is much more difficult that you'd think. Overall we could not recommend anyone to buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: K. Meehan

customer_reviews.title: not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Quit working after one day.The touch screen worked fine just no picture in the view screen when trying to take pictures.(What is a camera for?)Did we get a lemon?I looked up reviews afterwards and found simular issues and not so good pictures for a camera with 10 mp and costing so much.Fortunally we were refunded the full amount because there was no stock to send out another.Some other nikons might fare better but I like the reviews from Kodak better,sorry Nikon.
customer_reviews.author: Gary M. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Nikon Coolpix S60 10MP Digital Camera
customer_reviews.text: Nikon Coolpix S60 10MP Digital Camera with 5x Opti... this is a great camera. Still figuring out just how to use all the bells and whistles! Would definitely recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Robin J. Stanton

customer_reviews.title: the fun camera
customer_reviews.text: everybody i showed the camera to, loved it and wanted one,my wife is happy with it, what else can i say..the different things you can do with this camera makes it so cool to have....
customer_reviews.author: John Valle

customer_reviews.title: Mostly Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I thought the zoom would be better and the camera itself really has no memory so you should get a memory card when you get the camera.
customer_reviews.author: S. Southern

customer_reviews.title: defective camera
customer_reviews.text: I was sent a defective camera that stopped working on the second day. Now in dispute with seller about replacing it! VERY UNSATISFIED.
customer_reviews.author: drmichael

product_meta.title: Nikon Coolpix S60 10MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom (Burgundy)
product_meta.description:
FROM THE MANUFACTURER


 Nikon’s sleek, sexy Coolpix S60 combines 10.0 effective megapixels with an amazing 3.5-inch high-resolution, customizable touch-panel LCD that makes composing and sharing pictures easy. The Coolpix S60 has a 5x Zoom-Nikkor glass lens and, combined with Nikon’s Optical VR Image Stabilization system, gets you sharp pictures throughout the zoom range. In addition, Nikon’s EXPEED image processor is optimized for the Coolpix S60 and will ensure high-quality pictures with stunning color and sharpness. Use the camera’s HDMI capability to take pictures in 16:9 format and display them in an HD Pictmotion slide show, with music, on your HD television! 

Coolpix S60 Highlights 

10.0 megapixels for stunning prints as large as 16 x 20 inches. 

5x optical Zoom-Nikkor glass lens lets you zoom in on all the action. 

Optical VR Image Stabilization minimizes the effect of camera shake. 

New beautiful, bright 3.5-inch touch-panel LCD offers a 170-degree wide angle of view and enables easy access to all the camera controls without the conventional series of buttons to push. 

Customizable touch-panel display enables easy operation with a choice of three different Home displays, plus allows you to write a personal message on your photos with the included stylus pen. 

Slim, stylish, metal wave surface design slips right into your shirt pocket or purse! 

Auto adjusts up to ISO 3200 allows you to keep shooting, even in lower light without having to use flash. 

New Scene Auto Mode will automatically a scene and adjust the cameras settings. 

Smile Shutter and Blink Warning makes sure you’ll always catch the decisive moment when your subject smiles and blink warning will let you know when your subjects eyes are closed so you can retake your picture. 



REVIEW FROM WIRED.COM


 

Read more digital camera reviews
at Wired.com Pocket Digicam Looks Good, But It's Too Touchy 

With its high-gloss metal case and giant 3.5-inch, iPhone-like touchscreen, the Nikon Coolpix S60 just begs to be touched. But your lust will turn to disgust once you get to know this camera's internal quirks. In this case, beauty is only skin deep. 

It's immediately obvious that the S60's touch panel is what separates it from other point-and-shoot cameras. Other than the power and shutter buttons, all of the camera's controls are accessible by touch command. You can give the camera the finger or use the included guitar-pick-like stylus. 

Tapping the icons, menus and submenus takes you through the camera's many settings and picture modes. While some of the icons are easy to interpret, others require the 170-page manual be close at hand. The Scene Mode alone has 19 icons to choose from, including modes optimized for shooting food and museum art to dusk/dawn portraits and fireworks. You can even draw on pictures using the stylus. Although these sketches can be fun (look! Aunt Sally has a mustache!), they tend to look pixilated when transferred to a PC screen or printed. 

As with the iPhone, a simple flick of your finger on the S60's screen lets you scroll through the images in the camera's puny 20MB internal memory or its optional SD card. And with its gyroscopic sensor, merely rotating the camera will change the image view to either portrait or landscape orientation. But unlike the iPhone, the wide screen (which extends all the way to the edge of the camera's case) offers little space to hold the camera without inadvertently touching a setting or activating the zoom or wide-angle functions. Sadly, there is also a lag of a few seconds for some settings to execute, adding further frustration to the interface. 

The camera's optical image stabilization is a handy--and necessary--feature, along with distortion control and white-balance controls. Still, photo quality varied from sharp for well-lit outdoor shots to not-quite-sharp, unintentionally soft-focus images. The 30fps .avi videos offer excellent sound but grainy images. And you'll probably need a backup battery since the one included can poop out after only about 70 shots, especially if you use the touchscreen often. 

For the casual user, Nikon's Coolpix S60 is a fun camera to use, especially with all its built-in settings for specific shots. It's the perfect party companion--but if you take it home with you, you'll probably wind up being disappointed. 

RATING 5 out of 10 

WIRED Sleek and sexy. Fairly easy to use: Its iPhone-like touchscreen is appealing. Respectable 10 megapixels. Compact and lightweight (just 5.7 ounces). 

TIRED Images aren't very crisp, unless they're well-lit outdoors shots. Short-lived battery. Overly wide touchscreen leaves no room for your fingers to hold the camera without inadvertently switching settings.  * Read more digital camera reviews at Wired.com
feature_bullets: 10.0-megapixel resolution for stunning prints as large as 16 x 20 inches
5x optical Zoom-Nikkor glass lens; Optical VR Image Stabilization
3.5-inch high-resolution touch-panel LCD; customizable touch-panel display
Auto adjusts up to ISO 3200; Shutter and Blink Warning
Captures images to SD/SDHC cards (not included)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.5 out of 5 stars19 ratings3.5 out of 5 stars
